title: Campaign Events by Candidate and State
description: Here's an analysis showing the presidential candidates with the most campaign events during the 2020 election, in addition to a breakdown of the top 5 states where candidates hosted events most frequently.
contents:
Candidates with the most campaign events
Pete Buttigieg, Elizabeth Warren, Amy Klobuchar, Bernie Sanders, and Beto O’Rourke hosted the most campaign events leading up to the 2020 presidential elelection.


fig <- plot_ly(
  x = c("Buttigieg", "Warren", "Klobuchar", "Sanders", "O'Rourke"),
  y = c(74, 73, 70, 67, 64),
  type = "bar",
  color = "orange"
)
fig <- fig %>% layout(title = "Candidates with Most Campaign Events",
         xaxis = list(title = "Candidate"),
         yaxis = list (title = "Number of Campaign Events"))

fig

States hosting the most campaign events
Iowa, New Hampshire, South Carolina, Washington, DC, and California were the five most popular locations for 2020 presidential candidates’ campaign events. (Percentages based on data for top 5 states only)


State <- c("IA", "NH", "SC", "DC", "CA")
EventNumber <- c(200, 132, 90, 86, 69)
df <- data.frame(State, EventNumber)
#Data Visualisation
fig <- df %>% plot_ly(labels = ~State, values = ~EventNumber)
fig <- fig %>% add_pie(hole = 0.6)
fig <- fig %>% layout(
                  title = "States hosting the most campaign events",  showlegend = F,
                  xaxis = list(showgrid = FALSE, zeroline = FALSE, showticklabels = FALSE),
                  yaxis = list(showgrid = FALSE, zeroline = FALSE, showticklabels = FALSE))

fig

title: Consumer Complaints: Untimely Responses
description: Here is an analysis of consumer complaints from March 2020 to December 2020 that did not receive timely responses. Source: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
